content.raw: Can we place all the `ignition::transport` member variables at the end of the file with a note to always leave them there? By doing in it in this way, these members will be the first to be destructed (triggering unsubscribe(), unadvertise(), etc.) and will avoid situations in which a callback is executed and a member variable used inside the callback has been already destructed.
